intro: Calamus tenompokensis, commonly known as the Tenompokensis canes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in parts of Indonesia and the Philippines. This plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and pinnate leaves, which are often used in traditional crafts. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some botanical gardens and private collections.
